function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Factors such as health infrastructure, socioeconomic background, and health supplies affecting the spread of covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive association between latitude and number of covid-19 cases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in covid-19 cases per million inhabitants with increase in absolute latitude","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possible boost in covid-19 impact due to increasing temperatures and longer sunlight exposure during summer","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Regulated air travel may contribute to the spread of contagious diseases such as covid-19","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate testing intensity can lead to underreporting of covid-19 cases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited health expenditure may result in insufficient healthcare resources during a pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential increase in social interactions due to higher temperatures may lead to greater transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global crises such as the covid-19 pandemic and economic depression increase susceptibility to contagious diseases","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Nation-wide quarantines and lockdowns lead to economic impacts and social readjustment","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in household energy consumption","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential recurring risk of pandemics exacerbated by climate change impacts","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through the use of hems technologies and the interaction with end-users","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reluctance of residents to adopt hems due to associated costs","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of willingness to pay for hems leading to slower market growth","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Technology anxiety","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability of renters to make decisions on home improvements","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Collection of internet-based survey data with potential for biased responses due to self-selection","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through in-person data collection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate sanitation and hygiene during data collection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High population density and communal living may increase the risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased electricity consumption during pandemic due to stay-at-home mandates","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resemblance of electricity usage curve to that of coronavirus quarantines in u.s. and europe","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Composition of energy usage groups reflecting demographic differences","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Participants perceiving a low risk of covid-19 infection ≤20%","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential rebounding effects of higher emissions post-pandemic lockdowns","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Deprioritization of climate-related issues in global agendas due to the health crisis","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Positive relationship between electricity usage and perceived climate change issues","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in adoption intention for hems energy and wellbeing features during pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Participants were not willing to pay for certain hems features, potentially impacting the adoption and implementation of these features.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of misinformation and misinterpretation","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Psychological impact of risk perception","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adoption intention of hems wellbeing features during covid-19 influenced by attitudes, cost concerns, cybersecurity concerns, and demographics such as income, age, and household size.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Factors influencing willingness to pay wtp for hems wellbeing features during covid-19, including attitudes, perceived usefulness, and demographic factors.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious disease propagation due to increased use of telemedical services and community updates","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased wtp for wellbeing features among older residents","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Residents’ willingness to adopt and pay for hems","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Connection between actions and climate change issues","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low percentage of population viewing climate change as caused by human activities","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on reducing non-essential economic activities for tackling covid-19 and climate change","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Social-psychological factors influencing hems technology adoption intention and wtp during covid-19","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social norms as a strong predictor of adoption intention and willingness to pay for energy-related and well-being risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Small sample size in new york may not be representative of the entire new york city area or other cities in the u.s.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Failure to address social- psychological factors such as perceived fairness and social networks could result in overlooking important risk factors for disease propagation.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Household size may impact the propagation of contagious diseases within the home environment.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk perception and attitudes towards home energy management systems hems may affect the adoption of disease-containment features in the built features.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Highly resistant variants of covid-19 continue to emerge","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
